[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_address.rs] [Function: create_vesting_contract_address()] [Sequential nonce prediction] Since nonces are sequential u64 values, can an attacker predict future vesting contract addresses and front-run their creation to steal funds? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_address.rs] [Function: create_vesting_pool_address()] [Intermediate address manipulation] Can an attacker manipulate the intermediate 'contract' address at line 227 by controlling admin/nonce to produce a desired final vesting pool address? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_address.rs] [Function: create_vesting_pool_address()] [Operator confusion] Does passing the same operator to both vesting contract and stake pool creation create security issues with role separation or access control? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_address.rs] [Function: create_resource_address()] [Empty seed predictability] When seed is empty, does this create a single predictable resource address per source address that attackers can front-run? (Medium)
